text:
ﬁtness and health monitoring are cheap and ubiquitous. As such, sensor data from these devices
is cheaper to collect, more common, and therefore is a more commonly studied version of the
general activity recognition problem. The problem is to predict the activity given a snapshot of
sensor data, typically data from one or a small number of sensor types. Generally, this problem
is framed as a univariate or multivariate time series classiﬁcation task.
